title: Fire Department and Emergency Medical Services Dispatched Calls for Service
description: A. SUMMARY Fire Calls-For-Service includes all fire units' responses to 911 calls from the city's Computer-Aided Dispatch (“CAD”) system. This includes responses to Medical Incidents requiring EMS staff. Each record includes the call number, incident number, address, unit identifier, call type, and disposition. All relevant time intervals are also included. Because this dataset is based on responses, and since most calls involve multiple units, there are multiple records for each call number. Addresses are associated with an intersection or call box, not a specific address. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED This dataset is an extract from the Department of Emergency Management’s computer-aided dispatch system. The dataset is enhanced with fire-department specific information before being uploaded to the open data portal. C. UPDATE PROCESS This dataset updates daily via automated data pipeline. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET This dataset is based on responses, and since most calls involve multiple units, there are multiple records for each call number. The most common call types are Medical Incidents, Alarms, Structure Fires, and Traffic Collisions. E. RELATED DATASETS Fire Incidents

columns.name: Call Number
columns.description: A unique 9-digit number assigned by the 911 Dispatch Center (DEM) to this call. These number are used for both Police and Fire calls.

columns.name: Unit ID
columns.description: Unit Identifier. For example E01 for Engine 1 or T01 for Truck 1.

columns.name: Incident Number
columns.description: A unique 8-digit number assigned by DEM to this Fire incident.

columns.name: Call Type
columns.description: Type of call the incident falls into. See in metadata section for more information.

columns.name: Call Date
columns.description: Date the call is received at the 911 Dispatch Center. Used for reporting purposes.

columns.name: Watch Date
columns.description: Watch date when the call is received. Watch date starts at 0800 each morning and ends at 0800 the next day.

columns.name: Received DtTm
columns.description: Date and time of call is received at the 911 Dispatch Center.

columns.name: Entry DtTm
columns.description: Date and time the 911 operator submits the entry of the initial call information into the CAD system

columns.name: Dispatch DtTm
columns.description: Date and time the 911 operator dispatches this unit to the call.

columns.name: Response DtTm
columns.description: Date and time this unit acknowledges the dispatch and records that the unit is en route to the location of the call.

columns.name: On Scene DtTm
columns.description: Date and time the unit records arriving to the location of the incident

columns.name: Transport DtTm
columns.description: If this unit is an ambulance, date and time the unit begins the transport to the hospital

columns.name: Hospital DtTm
columns.description: If this unit is an ambulance, date and time the unit arrives to the hospital.

columns.name: Call Final Disposition
columns.description: Disposition of the call (Code). For example TH2: Transport to Hospital - Code 2, FIR: Resolved by Fire Department

columns.name: Available DtTm
columns.description: Date and time this unit is not longer assigned to this call and it is available for another dispatch.

columns.name: Address
columns.description: Address of intersection or call box point associated with incident (obfuscated address to protect caller privacy)

columns.name: City
columns.description: City of incident

columns.name: Zipcode of Incident
columns.description: Zip code of incident

columns.name: Battalion
columns.description: Emergency Response District (There are 10 Fire Emergency Response Districts)

columns.name: Station Area
columns.description: Fire Station First Response Area associated with the address of the incident

columns.name: Box
columns.description: Fire box associated with the address of the incident. A box is the smallest area used to divide the City. Each box is associated with a unique unit dispatch order. The City is divided into more than 2,400 boxes.

columns.name: Original Priority
columns.description: Initial call priority (Code 2: Non-Emergency or Code 3:Emergency).

columns.name: Priority
columns.description: Call priority once all information has been asssessed (Code 2: Non-Emergency or Code 3:Emergency).

columns.name: Final Priority
columns.description: Final call priority (Code 2: Non-Emergency or Code 3:Emergency).

columns.name: ALS Unit
columns.description: Does this unit includes ALS (Advance Life Support) resources? Is there a paramedic in this unit?

columns.name: Call Type Group
columns.description: Call types are divided into four main groups: Fire, Alarm, Potential Life Threatening and Non Life Threatening.

columns.name: Number of Alarms
columns.description: There are five levels of fire alarms (1-5). The number of alarms indicates the number of resources required in an incident. This number is a combination of engines, trucks, rescue squads, chiefs and EMS units.

columns.name: Unit Type
columns.description: Type of unit responding

columns.name: Unit sequence in call dispatch
columns.description: A number that indicates the order this unit was assigned to this call

columns.name: Fire Prevention District
columns.description: Bureau of Fire Prevention District associated with this address

columns.name: Supervisor District
columns.description: Supervisor District number

columns.name: Neighborhooods - Analysis Boundaries
columns.description: San Francisco Neighborhood associated with the incident address.

columns.name: RowID
columns.description: Unique identifier used for managing data updates. It is the concatenation of Call Number and Unit ID separated by a dash

columns.name: case_location
columns.description: Latitude and Longitude for the call

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was last updated in the source system.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: time the data was loaded into the Open Data Portal

columns.name: Analysis Neighborhoods
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Analysis Neighborhoods' (ajp5-b2md) the point in column 'case_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
